description: Deep semantic mapping of a concept: meaning boundaries, semantic neighbors, rhetorical deployments, conceptual tensions, strategic ambiguities, argumentative functions, and cross-document evolution. Reveals not just what a concept means, but how it works as a tool of thought and persuasion.
researcher_question: What is the full meaning-space of this concept - and how does the author deploy it strategically?

intellectual_origins: string - philosophical/theoretical traditions this concept draws from
key_thinkers: string - thinkers whose usage shapes this concept
historical_layers: string - accumulated meanings over time that the author inherits or rejects

concept_analyzed.author_innovation: string - what's distinctive about THIS author's use of the concept

semantic_neighbors.relationship: synonym | near_synonym | hypernym | hyponym | meronym | antonym | complement | contrast | related | precondition | consequence | transforms_into
semantic_neighbors.key_difference: string - what distinguishes this from the target
usage_contexts: string - contexts where this term is preferred
semantic_neighbors.what_substitution_loses: string - what nuance is lost if you substitute
semantic_neighbors.quote_example: string - example from text showing relationship
semantic_neighbors.argumentative_relationship: string - how does using one vs the other change the argument?

rhetorical_deployments.deployment_context: string - situation where the concept is invoked
rhetorical_deployments.rhetorical_function: legitimation | critique | reframing | boundary_drawing | coalition_building | opponent_characterization | bridge_concept | pivot_point
rhetorical_deployments.what_it_accomplishes: string - what work does using this concept do here?
rhetorical_deployments.quote: string - the passage where this deployment occurs
rhetorical_deployments.alternative_framing: string - how could this point be made without this concept?

conceptual_tensions.tension_type: internal_contradiction | scope_ambiguity | level_mixing | normative_descriptive_blur | implicit_value_judgment | definitional_instability

manifestation_1.interpretation: string - what the concept seems to mean here

manifestation_2.interpretation: string - what it seems to mean here (in tension with above)

conceptual_tensions.is_tension_acknowledged: boolean - does the author recognize this tension?
conceptual_tensions.how_author_manages: string - if acknowledged, how do they handle it?
conceptual_tensions.exploitation_potential: string - could a critic exploit this tension?

strategic_ambiguities.what_ambiguity_enables: string - what argumentative flexibility does vagueness provide?
strategic_ambiguities.what_ambiguity_conceals: string - what hard questions does vagueness avoid?

argumentative_functions.function_type: premise_supplier | conclusion_anchor | bridge_term | contrast_term | legitimacy_marker | critique_tool | normative_standard | descriptive_category | explanatory_key
argumentative_functions.description: string - how the concept functions in arguments
argumentative_functions.example_argument_pattern: string - sketch of an argument that uses the concept this way
argumentative_functions.indispensability: essential | helpful | ornamental - could the argument work without this concept?

inclusion_criteria.criterion: string - what makes something fall under this concept
inclusion_criteria.who_contests: string - if contested, what position contests it?

exclusion_criteria.is_exclusion_polemical: boolean - is this exclusion doing argumentative work?

boundary_policing.what_is_policed: string - what's being kept in or out
boundary_policing.stakes: string - why does it matter where the boundary is?

edge_cases.what_verdict_reveals: string - what does this judgment tell us about the concept?

definitional_variations.definition: string - how the concept is defined in this context
definitional_variations.what_it_downplays: string - what this definition de-emphasizes or obscures
definitional_variations.contrast_with_others: string - how it differs from other definitions
definitional_variations.rhetorical_advantage: string - what does defining it this way enable argumentatively?

presuppositions.presupposition: string - what you must accept to use the concept this way

counter_concepts.counter_concept: string - concept that this one implicitly argues against
counter_concepts.what_using_target_rejects: string - using THIS concept implies rejecting THAT framework

root_metaphors.source_domain: string - where the metaphor comes from
entailments: string - what follows if you accept this metaphor

competing_metaphors: string - alternative metaphorical framings the author rejects or ignores

cross_document_evolution.what_changes: string - how the concept's use shifts
cross_document_evolution.driver_of_change: string - what motivates the shift (responding to criticism, context change, etc.)

core_terms: string - terms closest to the target
semantic_field_map.superordinate: string - broader category containing this concept
conceptual_allies: string - concepts that work together with this one
conceptual_enemies: string - concepts this one is deployed against

typical_collocations: string - words that commonly appear with this concept

register_variations.technical: string - how used in technical contexts
register_variations.popular: string - how used in everyday contexts
register_variations.polemical: string - how used when arguing against opponents

frequency_patterns.most_concentrated: string - where does the concept appear most densely?
frequency_patterns.notably_absent: string - where might you expect it but it doesn't appear?

operationalization_analysis.abstract_meaning: string - the concept at its most general

concrete_applications.gap_from_abstract: string - what's lost in translation from abstract to concrete?

operationalization_analysis.operationalization_tensions: string - conflicts between how concept is defined vs how it's applied

meta.semantic_richness: number (0-1) - how dense the semantic field is
meta.boundary_clarity: number (0-1) - how clear the boundaries are
meta.definitional_consensus: number (0-1) - how much agreement on meaning
meta.strategic_flexibility: number (0-1) - how much the concept shifts to serve arguments
meta.key_insight: string - most important finding about this concept's meaning and deployment
meta.vulnerability_summary: string - where could a critic attack this concept's use?

extraction.core_question: What is the full meaning-space of this concept, and how is it deployed strategically?
extraction_steps: IDENTIFY CORE MEANING: What is the central meaning? Where does it come from intellectually?
MAP SEMANTIC NEIGHBORS: Find synonyms, related terms, contrasts - note what substitution would lose
ANALYZE RHETORICAL DEPLOYMENTS: How is the concept used to persuade? What work does it do?
IDENTIFY CONCEPTUAL TENSIONS: Where does the concept pull in different directions? Internal contradictions?
MAP STRATEGIC AMBIGUITIES: What's left vague, and what does vagueness enable?
TRACE ARGUMENTATIVE FUNCTIONS: What role does the concept play in arguments? Is it essential?
ANALYZE BOUNDARIES: Where does this concept end? Who contests the boundary and why?
DOCUMENT EDGE CASES: What borderline cases reveal about the concept's limits?
TRACK DEFINITIONAL VARIATIONS: How does meaning shift across contexts? What does each definition enable?
SURFACE PRESUPPOSITIONS: What must you already believe to use this concept this way?
IDENTIFY COUNTER-CONCEPTS: What frameworks does using this concept implicitly reject?
ANALYZE METAPHORICAL SUBSTRATE: What root metaphors shape understanding? What do they hide?
TRACK CROSS-DOCUMENT EVOLUTION: How does the concept's use shift across texts?
ASSESS OPERATIONALIZATION: Gap between abstract definition and concrete application?

key_fields.rhetorical_function: What persuasive work does deployment do

extraction.special_instructions: Go beyond dictionary definitions. Focus on how the AUTHOR deploys this concept strategically. Look for tensions, ambiguities, and rhetorical functions. Find places where the concept does argumentative work. Identify what using this concept commits the author to, and what it allows them to avoid. Be critical - find the weak points.

id_examples.to: Tension: efficiency as descriptive measure vs normative goal

concretization.naming_guidance: Use the term plus relationship type and distance
